## RESEARCH SUMMARY: Support Programs for Veteran Caregivers

I've completed a thorough research of support programs for Veteran caregivers (spouses, family members caring for disabled Veterans). Here's what I found, organized by category:

---

### 1. VA CAREGIVER SUPPORT PROGRAMS

#### **Program of Comprehensive Assistance for Family Caregivers (PCAFC)**

**Organization:** Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
**Website:** https://www.caregiver.va.gov/support/support_benefits.asp

**Services Offered:**
- Education and training
- Health insurance (if caregiver is otherwise uninsured)
- Mental health counseling
- Monthly financial stipend
- Respite care
- Case management and support services

**Eligibility:**

*For Veterans:*
- Single or combined service-connected disability rating of 70% or more
- In need of personal care services for a minimum of 6 continuous months

*For Caregivers:*
- At least 18 years old
- Spouse, son, daughter, parent, stepfamily member, or extended family member of the Veteran
- OR living full-time with the Veteran (or willing to do so)

**Financial Benefits:**
- Monthly stipend calculated based on OPM GS Annual Rate Grade 4, Step 1 for caregiver's locality
- Two tiers: Level 1 (62.5% of monthly rate) and Level 2 (100% for Veterans unable to self-sustain)
- **2026 Updates:** 10% monthly stipend increase, cost-of-living index adjustments, and broadened eligibility for all service eras
- Transition period extended through September 30, 2028 for legacy participants

**How to Access:**
- Contact your local VA facility Caregiver Support Team
- Call VA Caregiver Support Line (CSL): **1-855-260-3274**
- Apply at https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/

---

#### **Program of General Caregiver Support Services (PGCSS)**

**Organization:** Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
**Website:** https://www.caregiver.va.gov/care_caregivers.asp

**Services Offered:**
- Peer support mentoring
- Skills training and coaching
- Telephone support
- Online programs and resources
- Referrals to community resources
- Group support and one-on-one coaching
- Self-care programs

**Eligibility:**
- Available to caregivers of Veterans enrolled in VA health care
- Veterans must have served in any era
- No need to be a relative or live with the Veteran
- No formal application required; direct enrollment available

**Cost:** Free

**How to Access:**
- Call VA Caregiver Support Line (CSL): **1-855-260-3274**
- Contact your local VA facility Caregiver Support Team
- Visit https://www.caregiver.va.gov/

---

### 2. ELIZABETH DOLE FOUNDATION - HIDDEN HEROES CAMPAIGN

**Organization:** Elizabeth Dole Foundation
**Website:** https://www.elizabethdolefoundation.org/campaigns-programs/hidden-heroes
**Also:** https://hiddenheroes.org/

**Mission:**
Bringing vital attention to the untold stories of military and Veteran caregivers and seeking solutions for their challenges. There are 5.5+ million military caregivers providing nearly $14 billion worth of unpaid care annually.

**Programs:**

1. **Hidden Heroes Communities Program**
   - Network of cities, counties, and states finding local solutions
   - Community-based support and advocacy
   - State and local resources

2. **Dole Caregiver Fellowship**
   - Immersive multi-year leadership experience
   - Community building and support across all 50 states
   - Leadership development for caregivers

3. **Hope Fund for Critical Financial Assistance**
   - Emergency grants for:
     - Natural disaster assistance
     - Medical and dental bills
     - Home repairs
     - Emergency transportation
     - Vehicle modifications
     - Home appliances
     - Loss of income assistance
   - Application available at https://www.elizabethdolefoundation.org/

**Research & Resources:**
- Published research on caregiver challenges and needs
- Policy advocacy
- Educational resources

**How to Access:**
- Visit https://hiddenheroes.org/ for resources and community information
- Contact Elizabeth Dole Foundation directly through website
- Apply for Hope Fund financial assistance

---

### 3. RESPITE CARE OPTIONS

#### **VA Respite Care Programs**

**What is Respite Care?**
Temporary relief from caregiving responsibilities, either self-guided, informal, or formal professional care.

**Types of VA Respite Care:**

1. **In-Home Respite**
   - Professional home health aide provides care at Veteran's home
   - Caregiver can run errands or take time off
   - Through Office of Geriatrics and Extended Care

2. **Adult Day Health Respite**
   - Veteran attends adult day health care program
   - Structured activities and professional supervision
   - Provides daytime relief for caregiver

3. **Nursing Home Respite**
   - Short-term residential care at VA Community Living Center or community nursing home
   - Full-time care while caregiver has extended break

4. **Informal Respite**
   - Help from friends, family, or loved ones
   - Direct caregiving assistance or help with daily tasks

5. **Self-Guided Respite**
   - Personal wellness activities: meditation, prayer, walking, journaling, reading
   - Built into normal daily routine

**Available Through:**
- VA Caregiver Support Program (PCAFC includes respite as a benefit)
- Office of Geriatrics and Extended Care
- Call **1-855-260-3274** for enrollment

**Website:** https://www.caregiver.va.gov/support/Respite.asp

---

### 4. CAREGIVER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE & AID & ATTENDANCE

#### **VA Aid and Attendance Benefit**

**Organization:** Department of Veterans Affairs

**What It Is:**
Pension benefit program providing financial assistance to eligible Veterans and spouses who require aid and attendance or are housebound due to disability.

**Eligibility:**
- Veteran or surviving spouse
- Need for aid and attendance of another person to perform daily living activities
- OR housebound due to disability
- Income within limits
- Honorable or general discharge

**Benefits:**
- Monthly pension payments
- Amount varies based on individual circumstances and income level

**How to Apply:**
- Contact your local VA facility
- Call **1-855-260-3274**
- Application through VA.gov

---

### 5. CAREGIVER TRAINING AND SUPPORT PROGRAMS

#### **Building Better Caregivers (BBC)**

**Organization:** VA Caregiver Support Program (Licensed to Canary Health)
**Website:** https://va.buildingbettercaregivers.org/

**Format:** Online workshop, self-paced
**Duration:** 6 weeks
**Cost:** Free

**What It Covers:**
- Designed for caregivers of Veterans with:
  - Dementia and memory problems
  - PTSD
  - Traumatic brain injury
  - Serious illness or injury
  
**Content:**
- 6 weekly lessons
- Facilitator guidance
- Group support
- Alumni community access

**Recognition:** 
- Recognized as proven program by Benjamin Rose Institute on Aging and Family Caregiving Alliance

**How to Enroll:**
- Call VA Caregiver Support Line: **1-855-260-3274**
- Contact local VA Caregiver Support Team
- Visit https://va.buildingbettercaregivers.org/

---

#### **Caregivers FIRST Program**

**Organization:** VA Caregiver Support Program
**Format:** In-person group classes
**Duration:** Series of 4 proactive classes

**What It Covers:**
- Self-care and psychological coping
- Health system navigation
- Hands-on clinical skills training
- Evidence-based curriculum

**Eligibility:**
- Caregivers of Veterans of all eras
- All diagnoses welcome

**How to Access:**
- Contact local VA Caregiver Support Team
- Call **1-855-260-3274**

---

#### **Caregiver Action Network (CAN)**

**Organization:** Caregiver Action Network (Nonprofit)
**Website:** https://www.caregiveraction.org/ (inferred from search results)

**Services Offered:**
- Free education and resources
- Peer support groups
- Community resources and referrals
- Specialized support for military and Veteran families

**Cost:** Free of charge

**Coverage:**
- Broad range of family caregivers including Veteran families and wounded military families

**How to Access:**
- Visit website for local groups and resources
- Attend peer support meetings
- Access online educational materials

---

#### **Red Cross Military and Veteran Caregiver Network (MVCN)**

**Organization:** American Red Cross
**Website:** https://www.redcross.org/get-help/military-families/services-for-veterans/military-veteran-caregiver-network.html

**Services Offered:**
- Group mentoring
- One-on-one peer support using evidence-based models
- Caregiver-to-caregiver connection
- Support across all military eras and relationships

**Philosophy:**
Created for caregivers by caregivers

**Accessibility:**
- Multiple locations nationwide
- Virtual and in-person options

**How to Access:**
- Contact local Red Cross chapter
- Visit website for location information

---

#### **VA Caregiver Educational Curriculum**

**Organization:** Department of Veterans Affairs (Developed with University of Louisville)

**Modules Include:**
- VA 101 (How the VA works)
- VA Benefits information
- Empathy for Our Heroes
- Suicide Prevention training
- Mental Health awareness

**Format:** Classroom-based or online
**Cost:** Free

**How to Access:**
- Through VA Caregiver Support Program
- Contact **1-855-260-3274**
- Local VA facility Caregiver Support Team

---

### 6. ADDITIONAL SUPPORT NETWORKS

**Military OneSource**
- Free confidential counseling and support
- Caregiver-specific resources
- Website: https://www.militaryonesource.mil/

**Wounded Warrior Project (WWP)**
- Family support programs
- Caregiver resources and peer support
- Website: https://www.woundedwarriorproject.org/programs/family-support

**Blue Star Families**
- Caregiver support and community
- Resources for military and Veteran families
- Website: https://bluestarfam.org/caregivers/

---

## KEY CONTACT INFORMATION

**Primary Point of Contact:**
- **VA Caregiver Support Line (CSL): 1-855-260-3274**
- Available for enrollment, questions, and local referrals
- Free service

**Online Resources Hub:**
- https://www.caregiver.va.gov/ (Main VA Caregiver Support Program hub)
- https://hiddenheroes.org/ (Elizabeth Dole Foundation resources)
- https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/ (Comprehensive benefits information)

---

## SUMMARY FOR VIBE4VETS CONTEXT

The codebase currently includes:
- **Family category** in taxonomy for family-focused resources
- **SSVF connector** (Supportive Services for Veteran Families) for housing support
- **Multiple existing connectors** covering related services

**Potential data sources for caregiver-focused connector:**
- VA Caregiver Support Program directory (official data source, Tier 1)
- Elizabeth Dole Foundation - Hidden Heroes Communities (vetted nonprofit, Tier 2)
- State-level Veteran caregiver programs (via State VA connectors, Tier 3)
- Community caregiver organizations (Tier 4)

These programs represent comprehensive support spanning financial assistance, training, respite care, and peer support for Veteran caregivers nationwide.
